What is the purpose of the `submitmergedblock` command in Verus?

The `submitmergedblock` command is used to submit one or more new blocks to one or more networks. It can be used to submit blocks to Verus and/or PBaaS merge mined chains. The submitted block consists of a valid block for the specified chain, along with embedded headers of other PBaaS merge mined chains.

submitmergedblock "hexdata" ( "jsonparametersobject" )

Attempts to submit one more more new blocks to one or more networks.
Each merged block submission may be valid for Verus and/or PBaaS merge mined chains.
The submitted block consists of a valid block for this chain, along with embedded headers of other PBaaS merge mined chains.
If the hash for this header meets targets of other chains that have been added with 'addmergedblock', this API will
submit those blocks to the specified URL endpoints with an RPC 'submitmergedblock' request.
Attempts to submit one more more new blocks to one or more networks.

Arguments
1. "hexdata"  (string, required) the hex-encoded block data to submit

Results:
"  { rejected: "reject reason" }

Submission to our chain and PBaaS chains
"  { blockhash: "hex", accepted: true, pbaas_submissions: { "Quantum":"chainID_hex", ... } }

Submission to only PBaaS chains
"  { blockhash: "hex", accepted: "pbaas", pbaas_submissions: { "Quantum":"chainID_hex", ... } }

Examples:
> verus submitmergedblock "mydata"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "submitmergedblock", "params": ["mydata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/submitmergedblock
What are the arguments required for the `submitmergedblock` command?
The `submitmergedblock` command requires one argument: `"hexdata"` (a string, required), which is the hex-encoded block data to submit.

submitmergedblock "hexdata" ( "jsonparametersobject" )

What is the format of the result returned by the `submitmergedblock` command?

The `submitmergedblock` command returns a JSON object with the following possible formats:

* If the submission is rejected, the result will be `" { rejected: "reject reason" }`.
* If the submission is accepted for our chain and PBaaS chains, the result will be `" { blockhash: "hex", accepted: true, pbaas_submissions: { "Quantum":"chainID_hex",... } }".
* If the submission is accepted for only PBaaS chains, the result will be `" { blockhash: "hex", accepted: "pbaas", pbaas_submissions: { "Quantum":"chainID_hex",... } }"`.

How can I use the `submitmergedblock` command to submit a block to a PBaaS chain using the command line?

You can use the `submitmergedblock` command to submit a block to a PBaaS chain by running the following command:
```
verus submitmergedblock "mydata"
```
Replace `"mydata"` with the hex-encoded block data you want to submit.

submitmergedblock "hexdata" ( "jsonparametersobject" )

How can I use the `submitmergedblock` command to submit a block to a PBaaS chain using curl?

You can use the `submitmergedblock` command to submit a block to a PBaaS chain using curl by running the following command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "submitmergedblock", "params": ["mydata"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `"myusername"` with your username, `"mydata"` with the hex-encoded block data you want to submit, and `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the URL of the node you want to submit to.
